dependencies.description:
A common base representation of python source code for pylint and other
projects.
dependencies.name: py-astroid

dependencies.description: A Python utility / library to sort Python imports.
dependencies.name: py-isort

dependencies.description: Ned's script to check McCabe complexity.
dependencies.name: py-mccabe

dependencies.description: The PyPA recommended tool for installing Python packages.
dependencies.name: py-pip

dependencies.description:
A small Python module for determining appropriate platform-specific
dirs, e.g. a "user data dir"
dependencies.name: py-platformdirs

dependencies.description:
A Python utility that aids in the process of downloading, building,
upgrading, installing, and uninstalling Python packages.
dependencies.name: py-setuptools

dependencies.description: The blessed package to manage your versions by scm tags.
dependencies.name: py-setuptools-scm

dependencies.description:
A Python library for parsing and creating TOML configuration files. For
more information on the TOML standard, see https://github.com/toml-
lang/toml.git
dependencies.name: py-toml

dependencies.description:
Tomli is a Python library for parsing TOML. Tomli is fully compatible
with TOML v1.0.0.
dependencies.name: py-tomli

dependencies.description:
The typing_extensions module contains both backports of these changes as
well as experimental types that will eventually be added to the typing
module, such as Protocol (see PEP 544 for details about protocols and
static duck typing).
dependencies.name: py-typing-extensions

dependencies.description: A Spack managed Python virtual environment
dependencies.name: python-venv

dependent_to.description:
A source-to-source Fortran compiler designed to programmatically
optimise, parallelise and instrument HPC applications (written in
Fortran) via user- provided transformation scripts. Additionally,
PSyclone supports the development of kernel-based, Fortran-embedded DSLs
and is used in the UK Met Office's next-generation modelling system,
LFRic.
dependent_to.name: py-psyclone

dependent_to.description:
This project provides pylint formatters for a nice integration with
GitLab CI.
dependent_to.name: py-pylint-gitlab

dependent_to.description:
Run pylint with pytest and have configurable rule types (i.e.
Convention, Warn, and Error) fail the build. You can also specify a
pylintrc file.
dependent_to.name: py-pytest-pylint

variants.description: Build systems supported by the package
variants.name: build_system
